Text:
Links from the description (including some url-shortened links that were automatically removed):

- official website of the book: http://www.dspguide.com
- complete online version (read-only): http://ft-sipil.unila.ac.id/dbooks/The%20Scientist%20and%20Engineer%27s%20Guide%20to%20Digital%20Signal%20Process.pdf

(cont.)
- frontmatter: http://www.analog.com/static/imported-files/tech_docs/dsp_book_frontmat.pdf
- backmatter: http://www.analog.com/static/imported-files/tech_docs/dsp_book_backmat.pdf
- convert a pdf to hybrid roman/arabic pagination: http://askubuntu.com/a/34269
Thanks!  You are to be commended for sharing the result of all the time and effort you have put into this.

Oh, I forgot to mention: the main reason the complete version I found online is unusable isn't that it's write-protected, nor that it doesn't contain any of the niceties I described in points 3, 4 and 5 above, but that it botched up some formulas; for example: 3+4j shows up as 3%4j, √-1 shows up as √%1, etc.
